links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..100
formula: G.f.: (1+x)/(1+x^2)+x/T(0) where T(k)=  1 - (k+1)*(k+2)*x^2/T(k+1) ; (recursively defined continued fraction). - _Sergei N. Gladkovskii_, Feb 12 2013G.f.: (1+x)/(1+x^2)+x/G(0) where G(k) = 1 - 2*x^2*(4*k^2+4*k+1) - 4*x^4*(k+1)^2*(4*k^2+8*k+3)/G(k+1); (recursively defined continued fraction). - _Sergei N. Gladkovskii_, Feb 12 2013
mathematica: nn = 30; Range[0, nn]! CoefficientList[Series[Tan[x] + Sin[x] + Cos[x], {x, 0, nn}], x] (* _T. D. Noe_, Jul 16 2012 *)
prog: (Sage) # Variant of an algorithm of L. Seidel (1877).def A029582_list(n) :    dim = 2*n; E = matrix(ZZ, dim); E[0, 0] = 1    for m in (1..dim-1) :        if m % 2 == 0 :            E[m, 0] = 1;            for k in range(m-1, -1, -1) :                E[k, m-k] = E[k+1, m-k-1] - E[k, m-k-1]        else :            E[0, m] = 1;            for k in range(1, m+1, 1) :                E[k, m-k] = E[k-1, m-k+1] + E[k-1, m-k]    return [(-1)^(k//2)*E[k,0] for k in range(dim)]A029582_list(15)  # _Peter Luschny_, Jul 14 2012
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
